actor_awards.notes: Best known for his television roles as Colonel Sherman T. Potter in 'M*A*S*H' and Officer Bill Gannon in 'Dragnet'. He won a Primetime Emmy for his role in 'M*A*S*H'. Before TV stardom, he was a prolific character actor in films, often appearing in westerns and noirs.

filmography.title: The Ox-Bow Incident
filmography.role_description: A drifter who, along with his friend Gil Carter, gets swept up in a lynch mob mentality.
filmography.plot: When a posse captures three men suspected of killing a local farmer, they become strongly divided over whether or not to lynch the men.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Film

filmography.title: High Noon
filmography.role_description: A cowardly friend of the marshal who hides in his house rather than help defend the town.
filmography.plot: A town Marshal, despite the disagreements of his newlywed bride and the townspeople around him, must face a gang of deadly killers alone at high noon.

filmography.title: Inherit the Wind
filmography.role_description: The judge presiding over the 'Scopes Monkey Trial', trying to maintain order in a heated courtroom.
filmography.plot: Based on a real-life case in 1925, two great lawyers argue the case for and against a science teacher accused of teaching the theory of evolution.

filmography.title: The Big Clock
filmography.role_description: A silent, menacing bodyguard and masseur for the corrupt publishing tycoon Earl Janoth.
filmography.plot: A magazine editor tries to solve a murder investigation in which he has been framed by his powerful boss.

filmography.title: Dragnet
filmography.role_description: The loyal partner to Sgt. Joe Friday in this feature film adaptation of the famous TV series.
filmography.plot: Sergeant Friday and Officer Smith investigate a murder that looks like a mob hit.

filmography.title: The Shootist
filmography.role_description: The town marshal who is eager to see the dying gunfighter J.B. Books leave his town or die quickly.
filmography.plot: A dying gunfighter spends his last days looking for a way to die with a minimum of pain and a maximum of dignity.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Strategic Air Command
filmography.role_description: The flight engineer on the B-36 and B-47 bombers flown by Jimmy Stewart's character.
filmography.plot: A professional baseball player is recalled to military service to fly bombers for the Strategic Air Command.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: Support Your Local Sheriff!
filmography.role_description: The town mayor and father of the female lead in this western comedy.
filmography.plot: In the Old West, a man passing through a gold rush town on his way to Australia takes the job of sheriff to earn some money.

filmography.title: The Glenn Miller Story
filmography.role_description: A pianist and loyal friend to Glenn Miller throughout his musical career.
filmography.plot: The life story of big band leader Glenn Miller, from his early struggles to his death in World War II.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: The Union General who discusses strategy with General Sherman during the Civil War segment.
filmography.plot: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

filmography.title: Bend of the River
filmography.role_description: A hired hand assisting the wagon train who meets an unfortunate end.
filmography.plot: A town boss confiscates supplies from a wagon train, forcing the wagon master to try and steal them back.

filmography.title: The Far Country
filmography.role_description: A cowboy who drives cattle to Dawson with James Stewart's character.
filmography.plot: A self-minded adventurer locks horns with a crooked lawman while driving cattle to Alaska.

filmography.title: All My Sons
filmography.role_description: A neighbor of the Keller family in this adaptation of Arthur Miller's play.
filmography.plot: A manufacturer is accused of shipping defective airplane parts during WWII, a crime which caused the death of 21 pilots.

filmography.title: Dark City
filmography.role_description: The sidekick and friend to Charlton Heston's character, helping him evade a vengeful killer.
filmography.plot: A bookie is the target of a crazed brother of a man who committed suicide after losing money to him in a poker game.

filmography.title: Madame Bovary
filmography.role_description: A club-footed stable boy who becomes the subject of a disastrous medical experiment by Charles Bovary.
filmography.plot: The bored wife of a country doctor seeks to escape the banality of her life through affairs and overspending.

filmography.title: Yellow Sky
filmography.role_description: One of the bank robbers in Gregory Peck's gang who end up in a ghost town.
filmography.plot: A band of bank robbers on the run from the law take refuge in a ghost town, only to find an old man and his granddaughter prospecting for gold.
filmography.awards: Writers Guild Award: Win – Best Written American Western

filmography.title: Thunder Bay
filmography.role_description: An oil rigger working on the first offshore drilling operation.
filmography.plot: Two ex-Navy engineers try to build an oil drilling platform off the coast of Louisiana, clashing with local shrimp fishermen.

filmography.title: Frankie and Johnny
filmography.role_description: A piano player and composer who is the friend and sidekick to Elvis Presley's character.
filmography.plot: A riverboat singer and gambler tries to change his luck and find romance while dealing with a jealous girlfriend.

filmography.title: The Apple Dumpling Gang
filmography.role_description: The town sheriff and barber who marries the main characters in a shotgun wedding.
filmography.plot: Three bumbling outlaws find themselves saddled with three orphans who have struck gold.

filmography.title: The Teahouse of the August Moon
filmography.role_description: The long-suffering assistant to Colonel Purdy in occupied Okinawa.
filmography.plot: An American captain is sent to okinawan village to teach democracy, but the culture of the people proves too strong.
filmography.awards: Berlin International Film Festival: Nomination – Golden Bear

filmography.title: Cimarron
filmography.role_description: A rough-around-the-edges printer who works for the newspaper editor protagonist.
filmography.plot: A newspaper editor settles in an Oklahoma boom town with his reluctant wife at the end of the nineteenth century.

filmography.title: Support Your Local Gunfighter
filmography.role_description: A mining town mine owner vying for control against a rival.
filmography.plot: A gigolo con man arrives in a mining town and is mistaken for a famous gunfighter.

filmography.title: Snowball Express
filmography.role_description: An old mountain man living in the inherited hotel who helps the new owner.
filmography.plot: A New York accountant inherits a decrepit hotel in the Rocky Mountains and tries to turn it into a ski resort.

filmography.title: The Cat from Outer Space
filmography.role_description: A befuddled Army general trying to capture an alien cat and its spaceship.
filmography.plot: An extraterrestrial cat named Zunar-J-5/9 Doric-4-7 is stranded on Earth and needs the help of a scientist to fix his spaceship.

filmography.title: Dragnet
filmography.role_description: Reprising his famous TV role, now a captain, in this comedy update starring Dan Aykroyd and Tom Hanks.
filmography.plot: The strait-laced nephew of Joe Friday and his streetwise partner investigate a strange cult in Los Angeles.

filmography.title: State Fair
filmography.role_description: A carnival barker at the fair, one of his smaller early roles in a major musical.
filmography.plot: An Iowa family heads to the State Fair for romance, excitement, and blue ribbons.
